When I first started using JUnit (which is very recent) I built my folders =
using a \src\main and src\test directory structure. That way I could put th=
e test code into the same packages, but use Ant to strip it out of the fina=
l build. I do the same with the documentation that I generate. We use Javad=
ocs to generate internal documentation only, ant runs the javadoc but doesn=
't include that into the released jar.
	Our drive to remove the code was tw=
o-fold. (1) To keep the jar as small as possible because we are sometimes p=
ushing this code over 33.6k lines to rather out of the way places. (2) Word=
 from the mountain was that test code and javadocs are considered internal =
code only and could not be included in the final customer jars.
